title: Error: could not decrypt key with given password (in geth when personal.signTransaction after personal.unlockAccount)
body:
#### System information

Geth
Version: 1.10.20-stable
Architecture: amd64
Go Version: go1.18.4
Operating System: linux

#### Expected behaviour

Transaction gets signed, output of signed transaction. Why does not work? personal.unlockAccount returns true so I have reason to expect `geth` be able to sign transactions w/out using other way (via `clef`). Web search found several pages 
1. https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/issues/23824 (this one about clef)
2. https://ethereum.stackexchange.com/questions/23944/nodejs-web3j-error-could-not-decrypt-key-with-given-passphrase (from 2017 with answer to do eth.sendTransaction after successful personal.unlockAccount)

#### Actual behaviour

Error: could not decrypt key with given password
	at web3.js:6365:9(45)
	at send (web3.js:5099:62(34))
	at <eval>:1:25(27)

#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour
./geth --keystore ./keystore account new
./geth --keystore ./keystore account new

./geth --keystore ./keystore --nodiscover --maxpeers 0 console
> eth.accounts
// shows 2 accounts
> personal.unlockAccount(eth.accounts[0],"given_pass",0)
true
> personal.unlockAccount(eth.accounts[1],"given_pass",0)
true
> personal.signTransaction({from: eth.accounts[0], to: eth.accounts[1], value: web3.toWei(0.5, "ether"),nonce: 1, gas: 10, gasPrice: 10})
WARN [07-22|12:35:49.170] Failed transaction sign attempt          from=0x962ce8D388eCB05B273C418B94B66E69dFe7a55A to=0x1c92EE9f718e768125E54310b544Af594166F994 value=500,000,000,000,000,000 err="could not decrypt key with given password"
WARN [07-22|12:35:49.170] Served personal_signTransaction          reqid=18 duration=643.594166ms err="could not decrypt key with given password"
Error: could not decrypt key with given password
	at web3.js:6365:9(45)
	at send (web3.js:5099:62(34))
	at <eval>:1:25(27)

#### Backtrace

````
[backtrace]
````

When submitting logs: please submit them as text and not screenshots.
Are you using the Geth console? `personal.signTransaction` should ask you for a password there. If you're calling it from the outside, you might need to specify the password as the second parameter.
